results.title: The Icecream treaty
results.brief_description: The Antarctic Treaty’s aim is to protect the frozen continent whilst allowing peaceful scientific research. Due to renegotiation in 1991, the seven claimants face increasing pressure from a world hungry for the Antarctic’s riches. This video looks at how the people from many countries working there survive in the harsh but stunning surroundings.

results.title: The Ice storm
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, James Schamus, Ted Hope and Good Machine
results.brief_description: Thanksgiving, 1973, Connecticut, and the future of the United States is in limbo. Though outwardly possessing everything a suburban family could want, inwardly, the Hoods are on thin ice. The transparent windows of the family depict a dysfunctional life of paranoid gossip and swinging key parties. Patriarch Ben Hood, barely communicates with his wife Elena. Frustrated and lonely, Elena is on the verge of an emotional breakdown, while Ben copes by having an affair with their neighbour Janey Carver. As night falls and the members of the family embark on their own sexual odyssey, clouds gather on the horizon for an ice storm that will paralyze the suburbs and transform everyone’s lives for ever. Cast includes Kevin Kline, Joan Allen, Sigourney Weaver, James Sheridan, and Christina Ricci.

results.title: The Hurricane
results.brief_description: A wonderful film for its time, particularly in the special effects area. The plot has it all - romance and passion, heroes and traitors, adventure and devastation, climaxing with an epic disaster of the natural kind in the form of a hurricane. Based on the novel by Charles Nordhoff and James Norman Hall, adapted by Oliver H.P. Garrett, with screenplay by Dudley Nichols, “The Hurricane” is set on the French colonised island Manakoora in the South Seas ruled by the cold and ruthless Governor Eugene De Laage (Raymond Massey) along with his kind-hearted and sensitive wife, Madame Germaine De Laage (Mary Astor). However the main characters of the story are the island chief’s daughter Marama (Dorothy Lamour) and her handsome hero husband, Terangi (John Hall) who is wrongly jailed whilst visiting in Tahiti. With Terangi’s escape and bid to return to his wife and his island home the story takes on an intensity that finally erupts into a breath-taking and havoc-wreaking finale. A classic film with a cast including C. Aubrey Smith, Thomas Mitchell, John Carradine and Jerome Cowan.

results.title: The Hurricane
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Armyan Bernstein, John Ketcham and Azoff Films
results.brief_description: Denzel Washington stars in this true life story of Rubin “Hurricane” Carter, a top ranking boxing champion many people thought would be the next world champion. One night on leaving a nightclub with a fellow patron, he is pulled up by the police and accused of murdering 3 people. Despite professing his innocence and a lack of police evidence as well as motive, Carter is given 3 consecutive life sentences in prison. What was very clear to some was that this was a case based on racism and revenge, resting in the mind of a disturbed police officer who had it in for Rubin since he was 11. Having twice had his appeal and right to a re-trial turned down, it is not until Rubin receives a letter from Lesra that his luck and life begins to change. Lesra discovers a copy of “The Sixteenth round”, a book written by Rubin, in a second hand book store. Reading the book inspires the youngster, who, along with the help of three friends decides to devote their time and money to getting Rubin a fair trial. Denzel Washington received an Oscar nomination for best Actor at the 1999 Academy Awards for his excellent portrayal of Rubin “Hurricane” Carter.

results.title: Nightmare: the birth of horror
results.brief_description: The Victorian era saw the proliferation of the creation of horror stories that have permeated mass culture in the 21st Century. This series, written, presented and researched by Professor Christopher Frayling, recounts the origins of classic horror novels such as “Frankenstein”, “Dracula” and “The Hounds of the Baskerville”.

results.title: Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde = Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
As legend would have it, Robert Louis Stevenson would awake from a nightmare one night in 1885 inspired to write “Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde,” a tale that many critics have viewed at various times as an aberration to an otherwise successful literary career of writing adventure stories. It wasn’t the first of his nightmares though, as this informative documentary traces RLS’s childhood in Edinburgh, Scotland, which was fraught with his own medical problems, absent parents, and a very close relationship with his religious zealot Nanny. It was a time permeated by nightmares. Researched, written and presented by Professor Christopher Frayling, this episode in “Nightmare: the birth of horror” series focuses on the inspiration behind Stevenson’s tale of a divided self with a heart of darkness, its questionable sexuality, the influence of Jack the Ripper and deviance from the original work, and the impact that fans and family - in particular his wife who oversaw his authorised biography - have had on influencing the cult of Robert Louis Stevenson that is perpetuated today.

results.title: The Huntsman
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Toronto writer David Lewis Stein about a ten-year-old boy who ferrets out golf balls from the rough, then sells his findings to passing golfers. There is an unexpected development when two unscrupulous older boys try to muscle in on his business. A children’s film, but one that many adults will enjoy.

results.title: Dracula
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
Appearing on screen in over 200 different incantations, the character of Dracula is the most famous of horror icons and set the template for a mass horror movement. Taking Bram Stoker’s novel as the basis, writer and presenter Professor Christopher Frayling traces the origins of the vampire myth and the inspiration behind the novel - a combination of nightmare, literary influences, location and personal anecdotes. Frayling reviews the existing documentation of Stoker’s notes and moves through how the story came into being, the process Stoker took in writing the novel, and how it has developed, been interpreted and reinterpreted since then, in comic strips, melodramas and motion pictures.

results.title: The Hunt for Red October
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Mace Neufeld and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Red October is a technologically superior Soviet nuclear submarine under the command of Captain Marko Ramius (Sean Connery). It is heading for the United States coastline and has the American government in panic mode who presume that the submarine is preparing for attack. Only one man is prepared to consider the possibility that there is another motive. CIA analyst Jack Ryan (Alec Baldwin starring in the role that later featured Harrison Ford) has a different idea; he thinks Ramius is defecting from the Russian navy and it’s a race to see whether Ryan can prove his case before the Russians catch up with Red October and the wayward Ramius. Based on the novel by Tom Clancy. Cast includes James Earl Jones, Sam Neill, Scott Glen and Joss Ackland.

results.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
Touted as being the greatest detective story every written, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s horror story is also famous for being the novel that brought the resurrection of Sherlock Holmes, and the beginning of the commercialisation of his most famous detective. Killed off in “The Final problem” in 1893, Holmes met his fate after falling into a waterfall chasing his nemesis, Moriaty - neither body was recovered. Years later, Conan Doyle became interested in folklore surrounding the legend of the Hound of the Baskervilles: Sir Hugo and his hounds of hell, punished by a fierce dog for attacking a young woman, his family fated to misfortune forever after. The only man up to the task was Holmes, and the claim was made that the Baskerville investigation was an old case rediscovered after his death. This program in “Nightmare: the birth of horror” series examines the locales, literature and country folklore that influenced Conan Doyle when writing the novel - significantly, the only one to demonstrate his interest in the natural and the supernatural world. Provides depictions of Holmes across print and screen, and what Professor Christopher Frayling believes makes the book a classic.
